summary: This is an email chain from September 2019 discussing preparations for an upcoming interview with an individual identified as Epstein's long-time New York house manager. The purpose of the interview is to identify other employees and gather information about activities at the New York residence. The emails coordinate attendance and strategy for the interview.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The email signature identifies an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, indicating legal oversight of the investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview with Epstein's House Manager
events.description: An interview is scheduled with Jeffrey Epstein's long-time New York house manager to identify other employees and gather information about activities at the New York residence.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from September 2019 regarding investigative steps in the Epstein case.
Investigators planned to interview Epstein's long-time New York house manager to identify other employees and gather observations.
The interview was considered preliminary, aimed at getting names and basic information rather than assessing credibility in depth.
The correspondence shows coordination between legal and investigative team members in the Southern District of New York.
